title: How to Make Easy No Bake Cheesecake

methods.name: Cream cheese and whipped topping no-bake cheesecake

steps.headline: Cream softened cream cheese manually by hand or with a mixer.
Add whipped topping and sugar.
steps.description: Mix well.

steps.headline: Pour mixture into the graham cracker crust.
Chill in the refrigerator for an hour.
Add the cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk to the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat until smooth and creamy. This can be done by hand or using an electric mixer; the latter is faster.

steps.headline: Pour in the lemon juice and vanilla.
steps.description: Beat in well.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust.
steps.description: Ensure a smooth surface across the top (run a spatula or back of a spoon over it).

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Refrigerate for 3 hours or until it sets firmly.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add whipped cream, berry fruits or other standard accompaniments to a cheesecake.

steps.headline: Add the cream cheese to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat until creamy and smooth in consistency.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk and sour cream.
steps.description: Beat to combine thoroughly.

steps.headline: Set aside half of the cream cheese batter in a second bowl.
Add the Nutella and 1/2 a cup of the Cool Whip on the first cream cheese batter.
Transfer to the pie crust.
Add the remaining 2 cups of Cool Whip to the second bowl of batter set aside earlier.
steps.description: Fold in.

steps.headline: Transfer this second batter gently across the already added layer.
steps.description: Use the back of the spoon to neaten across the top.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill and set.
steps.description: It will need to be refrigerated for at least 4 hours.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve with whipped cream, crumbled cookies, fresh berries or other favorite toppings for cheesecake.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Either microwave at medium for 30 seconds to1 minute, with additional 15 second bursts if needed (stir after each burst); or, use a double boiler to melt.

steps.headline: Set the melted chips aside.
steps.description: Let them cool.

steps.headline: Add the cream cheese, sugar and butter into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat until creamy and smooth. Either do this by hand or using an electric mixer.

steps.headline: Add the melted chocolate gradually.
steps.description: Beat slowly or using a low speed. Combine well.

steps.headline: Fold in the whipped topping.
steps.description: It must be well combined.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture to the pre-made pie crust.
steps.description: Use the back of a spoon or a spatula to smooth.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Chill for 3 hours or until set.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve with whipped cream, fresh berries, grated chocolate or other sweet toppings of choice. This goes nicely drizzled over with cherries in syrup.

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Cream cheese and whipped topping no-bake cheesecake Cream softened cream cheese manually by hand or with a mixer.  Add whipped topping and sugar. Mix well. Pour mixture into the graham cracker crust.  Chill in the refrigerator for an hour.  Condensed milk no-bake cheesecake Add the cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk to the mixing bowl. Beat until smooth and creamy. This can be done by hand or using an electric mixer; the latter is faster. Pour in the lemon juice and vanilla. Beat in well. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust. Ensure a smooth surface across the top (run a spatula or back of a spoon over it). Place in the refrigerator. Refrigerate for 3 hours or until it sets firmly. Serve. Add whipped cream, berry fruits or other standard accompaniments to a cheesecake. Nutella no-bake cheesecake Add the cream cheese to a mixing bowl. Beat until creamy and smooth in consistency. Pour in the milk and sour cream. Beat to combine thoroughly. Set aside half of the cream cheese batter in a second bowl.  Add the Nutella and 1/2 a cup of the Cool Whip on the first cream cheese batter.  Transfer to the pie crust.  Add the remaining 2 cups of Cool Whip to the second bowl of batter set aside earlier. Fold in. Transfer this second batter gently across the already added layer. Use the back of the spoon to neaten across the top. Place in the refrigerator to chill and set. It will need to be refrigerated for at least 4 hours. Serve. Serve with whipped cream, crumbled cookies, fresh berries or other favorite toppings for cheesecake. Chocolate no-bake cheesecake Melt the chocolate chips. Either microwave at medium for 30 seconds to1 minute, with additional 15 second bursts if needed (stir after each burst); or, use a double boiler to melt. Set the melted chips aside. Let them cool. Add the cream cheese, sugar and butter into the mixing bowl. Beat until creamy and smooth. Either do this by hand or using an electric mixer. Add the melted chocolate gradually. Beat slowly or using a low speed. Combine well. Fold in the whipped topping. It must be well combined. Transfer the mixture to the pre-made pie crust. Use the back of a spoon or a spatula to smooth. Place in the refrigerator. Chill for 3 hours or until set. Serve. Serve with whipped cream, fresh berries, grated chocolate or other sweet toppings of choice. This goes nicely drizzled over with cherries in syrup. Finished.
